discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
"A", because Compliance information is not important. Lame

questions.question_text: Which of the following components should a penetration tester most likely include in a report at the end of an assessment?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
A. Attestation letter - does not contain specific findings (Executive summary does!)

Selected Answer: C
Executive summary. It is an overview of the engagement that exposes and sheds light on vulnerabilities to the outside world while, at the same time, not exposing confidential, client-specific information

questions.question_text:
In a standard engagement, a post-report document is provided outside of the report. This document:

• Does not contain specific findings
• Exposes vulnerabilities
• Can be shared publicly with outside parties that do not have an in-depth understanding about the client's network

Which of the following documents is described?

A penetration tester is configuring a vulnerability management solution to perform a scan of Linux servers on an enterprise network. The client wants to reduce potential disruptions as much as possible. Which of the following types of accounts should the tester use?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
When configuring a vulnerability management solution to scan Linux servers, a read-only user account is ideal to minimize potential disruptions. This type of account:

 Allows the scanner to access necessary system information (e.g., configuration files, installed packages) without modifying anything.
 Reduces the risk of causing unintentional changes or disruptions to the system.
 Provides sufficient privileges for vulnerability scanning without granting excessive access.

questions.question_text: A penetration testing team has gained access to an organization's data center, but the team requires more time to test the attack strategy. Which of the following wireless attack techniques would be the most successful in preventing unintended interruptions?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
B is a stealthier approach compared to jamming, which would disrupt network communications and likely raise alarms.

Selected Answer: B
I vote B, an evil twin will be a lot less noticeable than jamming. Jamming is more about disruption, thinking about DoS attacks and would be highly visible. In comparison and evil twin will be more stealth and useful for credential harvesting.

comments.content: I don't think the scenario care much about detection but rather reducing interruption while the testing ongoing for few days, I think Evil twin would be suitable for monitoring without causing interruptions.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
Evil twin is not useful for delaying detection in a data center.

Selected Answer: B
The key here is "reference clock" at the top of the output
